oclcdc.title: American Swedish Institute (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The American Swedish Institute, a historic museum dedicated to the celebration of Swedish culture, is home to collections on the history of Swedish immigration to the United States, particularly immigration to Minnesota, Swedish-American life and culture and the history and culture of Sweden as it has influenced Swedish America. The American Swedish Institute contributed to Minnesota Reflections images from, Svenska Amerikanska Posten, a Swedish-American newspaper, taken between 1898 and 1903.
oclcdc.creator: American Swedish Institute
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the written permission of the American Swedish Institute.

oclcdc.title: Amherst H. Wilder Foundation (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Amherst H. Wilder Foundation is a non-profit health and human services organization founded by a philanthropic Saint Paul businessman, Amherst H. Wilder and his family. For more than 100 years, Wilder has combined direct service, research, and community development to address the needs of the most vulnerable people in greater Saint Paul.
oclcdc.creator: Amherst H. Wilder Foundation
oclcdc.rights: These images are the property of the Amherst H. Wilder Foundation and may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Foundation. For permission to use this image, contact the Amherst H. Wilder Foundation, 451 Lexington Parkway North, St. Paul, MN 55104; (651) 280-2790, e-mail: library@wilder.org.

oclcdc.title: Anoka County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Anoka County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Anoka County Historical Society, in Anoka, Minnesota, collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to Anoka County. The society supports genealogical research with a wide range of historical resources. Images Anoka County Historical Society contributed to Minnesota Reflections show early street scenes, business activities, farming, schools, transportation, fairs, parades, portraits and disasters.
oclcdc.creator: Anoka County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the expressed written consent of the Anoka County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Baptist General Conference History Center (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The work of the Baptist General Conference History Center was established in 1898. Located on the campus of Bethel University, the BGCHC collects, preserves and disseminates materials significant to Swedish Baptist institutional, cultural, and immigration history; the Baptist General Conference; and Bethel University. The images submitted from the BGCHC collection represent a sampling of Baptist General Conference churches of Minnesota and Bethel University campus scenes.
oclcdc.creator: Baptist General Conference History Center
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Baptist General Conference History Center, St. Paul, Minnesota.

oclcdc.title: Basilica of St. Mary (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The archival collection of the Basilica of Saint Mary contains documents and artifacts dating to the parish's founding in 1858. Images contributed to Minnesota Reflections include photographs documenting the life of the church from 1907 to 1966, and also architectural drawings for the interior finish of the Basilica church, rectory and sacristy in the 1920s, primarily from the St. Paul firm Slifer & Abrahamson.
oclcdc.creator: Basilica of St. Mary
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Basilica of Saint Mary.

oclcdc.title: Becker County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Becker County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: From Detroit Lakes, Minn., in the northwestern part of the state, the Becker County Historical Society serves the public with a museum, archive collection, cultural demonstrations and K-12 workshops. Their holdings include artifacts dating back to the glacial period of the county, a newspaper microfilm archive, photo collection and an index of courthouse records. Becker County Historical Society's contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes photographs of the lumber industry and portraits of early settlers.
oclcdc.creator: Becker County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Becker County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Beltrami County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Beltrami County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Beltrami County Historical Society operates out of the James J. Hill railroad depot in Bemidji, Minnesota. The historical society collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to the history of this north central Minnesota county. In Minnesota Reflections, Beltrami has images showing early street scenes, milling and lumber industry activities, farming, schools and transportation.
oclcdc.creator: Beltrami County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Beltrami County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Bethel University (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Bethel University is a leader in Christian higher education with approximately 6,400 students from 25 countries enrolled in undergraduate, graduate, seminary, and adult education programs. The Bethel University archive collection includes photographs and documents related to the history of this St. Paul, Minnesota, institution from its beginnings as a seminary in 1871, to Bethel Academy in 1905, and then the combined institution of Bethel Academy and Theological Seminary in 1914. The photographs in Minnesota Reflections show student and faculty life and buildings on both the early campus, across from the Minnesota State Fairgrounds, and the current Arden Hills campus in the mid 1960s to early 1980s.
oclcdc.creator: Bethel University
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Bethel University Digital Library, 3900 Bethel Drive, Saint Paul, MN 55112.

set.setName: Big Stone County Historical Society Museum

oclcdc.title: Big Stone County Historical Society Museum (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Big Stone County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: In Ortonville, Minnesota, the Big Stone County Historical Society Museum serves the public with genealogy records, a wildlife museum with an extensive taxidermy collection, fossils and artifacts. Their exhibits include a 1900s boat, church, log cabins, machinery, walking trail and a lookout tower gives a breathtaking view of the Minnesota River Valley. The Big Stone County Historical Society's Minnesota Reflections project includes images from the Reed Studio Collection, the A.L Lee Collection, the Elite Art Studio Collection, the Utley Collection and images from the general collection, notably from traveling photographer C. I. Angell.
oclcdc.creator: Big Stone Historical Society Museum
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Big Stone County Historical Society Museum.

oclcdc.title: Blue Earth County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Blue Earth County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Blue Earth County Historical Society in Mankato, Minnesota, collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to the history of this south central Minnesota county. Among the images Blue Earth County Historical Society contributed to Minnesota Reflections are photographs of the Hubbard Milling Company, Mankato State Normal School (now Minnesota State University, Mankato), Bethany Lutheran College and steamboat transportation on the Minnesota River.
oclcdc.creator: Blue Earth County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Blue Earth County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Carleton College (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Rice County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Carleton Archives was established in 1967 to preserve the history of Carleton College, Northfield. The photos, taken between 1871 and 1922, reflect student life. They include sports and recreational events, such as field day, gymnastics, football, hockey and baseball teams, a freshman picnic, Bouncing Day, Carleton Circus and May Fete. Some photos depict the first college class in 1871, the parade at a presidential inauguration and class lectures. They all exemplify the early history of Carleton College, which was founded in 1866, one of the first private colleges in Minnesota.
oclcdc.creator: Carleton College
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Carleton College Archives.

oclcdc.title: Carlton County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Carlton County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Carlton County Historical Society in Cloquet, Minnesota, serves the citizens of northeastern Minnesota by collecting photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to the history of northeastern county. Their contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes photographs of several towns, especially the settling and development of Cloquet. Topics include industrial scenes, village life, school groups, disasters and street scenes.
oclcdc.creator: Carlton County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the express written consent of the Carlton County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: CentraCare Health - St. Cloud Hospital (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stearns County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: St. Cloud Hospital Archives collects information and artifacts pertaining to health care history in St. Cloud, Minnesota, and the region. Its scope stretches from 1882, when the Sisters of the Order of Saint Benedict in St. Joseph, Minnesota, determined to establish a hospital in St. Cloud. It chronicles four successive Benedictine hospitals until 1962 when the Sisters created The St. Cloud Hospital as an independent, Catholic, non-profit corporation governed and administered by lay, medical and religious leaders. The Archives documents the hospital’s evolution from a community to a regional medical facility. The hospital’s collaboration with St. Cloud Clinic of Internal Medicine in 1995 to form CentraCare Health System, and its growth as an integrated network of health care professionals and facilities providing comprehensive, high-quality care to people in Central Minnesota, propels the record into the 21st century. They contributed to Minnesota Reflections highlights of graduates of the hospital’s nursing school, 1908 – 1987.
oclcdc.creator: CentraCare Health - St. Cloud Hospital
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact St. Cloud Hospital Archives for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Clay County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Clay County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Clay County Historical Society was established in Moorhead, Minnesota, in 1932 to collect, preserve and disseminate the history of Clay County. Collections include the Flaten/Wange Glass Plate Negative Collection. The negatives are the work of two photographers, S. P. Wange of Hawley and Ole E. Flaten of Moorhead. The Society has contributed to Minnesota Reflections 75 images shot by Flaten of Moorhead street scenes, events and institutions between 1879 and 1929. These include photos showing steamboats on the Red River, Concordia College and Moorhead State Normal School and the development of Moorhead from a frontier town to a regional commercial and educational center.
oclcdc.creator: Clay County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the express written consent of the Clay County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Clearwater County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Clearwater County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: From its home on the grounds of the historic Shevlin School just north of Bagley, Minnesota, the Clearwater County Historical Society preserves historic structures and collects photographs and artifacts related to Clearwater County. They contributed scenes from the early development of the county to Minnesota Reflections.
oclcdc.creator: Clearwater County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Clearwater County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: College of St. Scholastica (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: As the only private college in Minnesota's upper northeast, The College of St. Scholastica provides unique cultural and academic opportunities for its Duluth community. The college was founded by the Benedictine Sisters of the St. Scholastica Monastery in 1912 with the mission to prepare students for "responsible living and meaningful work." The collection contains photographs, which depict the academic and cultural sides of the college such as students in the classroom, clinical experiences, laboratories, physical education, graduation, leisure time, and concerts as well as documents, including catalogs listing the courses and programs offered and rules and regulations.
oclcdc.creator: College of St. Scholastica
oclcdc.rights: Use of these documents is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Documents are property of The College of St. Scholastica. Please contact The College of St. Scholastica Archives for permission to publish these documents.

set.setName: Commission of Deaf, DeafBlind, and Hard of Hearing Minnesotans

oclcdc.title: Commission of Deaf, DeafBlind, and Hard of Hearing Minnesotans (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Commission of Deaf, DeafBlind, and Hard of Hearing Minnesotans is a governor-appointed state commission that advocates for equal opportunity for and with Minnesotans who are deaf, deafblind, and hard of hearing. The collection in Minnesota Reflections consists of items contributed by deaf, deafblind, and hard of hearing community members via the Commission in order to preserve their unique heritage and make it available for sharing. The collection includes photos and other historical information contributed by the Charles Thompson Memorial Hall, the Minnesota Association of Deaf Citizens, and the Minnesota State Academy for the Deaf Alumni Association Museum.
oclcdc.creator: Commission of Deaf, DeafBlind, and Hard of Hearing Minnesotans
oclcdc.rights: These materials may be reproduced and used freely without written permission for educational purposes only. All reproductions require acknowledgement of the contributing organization. To use these materials for any other reason, contact the contributing organization for express written permission through the Commission of Deaf, DeafBlind and Hard of Hearing Minnesotans, 444 Lafayette Road North, St. Paul, MN 55155-3814. http://mn.gov/deaf-commission.

oclcdc.title: Concordia University, St. Paul (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The library at Concordia University, St. Paul, collects monographs, photographs and documents related to the history of this Lutheran Church-Missouri Synod school founded in 1893. Their contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes scenes of student life from the university's early years. Photographs show scenes of excursions to Minnehaha Falls, ice fishing and boating on the Mississippi River.
oclcdc.creator: Concordia University, St. Paul
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the written consent of Concordia University Library.

oclcdc.title: Cook County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Cook County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Cook County Historical Society's History Museum, in the Lightkeeper's House, a building on the National Register of Historic places, preserves and disseminates the county's history. Located in Grand Marais, the museum holds a large collection of artifacts, archives, photographs and oral histories. Cook County saw some of the state's earliest historical activity, but has remained a frontier throughout the years. The Civilian Conservation Corps photograph collection contributed to Minnesota Reflections demonstrates the works of the depression-era program in the Cook County region while providing a window into the daily lives and social activities of the young men enrolled in the Corps.
oclcdc.creator: Cook County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduce for any reason without the express written consent of the Cook County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Cottonwood County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Cottonwood County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Cottonwood County Historical Society in Windom, Minnesota, collects and preserves photographs and artifacts related to the 135-year history of this south central Minnesota county. The society, which pioneer settlers began in 1901, contributed to Minnesota Reflections scenes from the county's early settlement days.
oclcdc.creator: Cottonwood County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Cottonwood County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Crow Wing County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Crow Wing County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Crow Wing County Historical Society has been preserving Crow Wing County's history since 1927. The museum, located in Brainerd, Minnesota, is housed in the old Crow Wing County Jail and Sheriff's residence, built in 1917. the museum has three floors of exhibits including displays on the lumber industry, the railroads, mining, and home life. Venture into your own history using the museum's research library; look through hundreds of historical photographs, maps, and books. The Crow Wing County 1913 Standard Atlas (plat book) is now part of the Minnesota Reflections collection.
oclcdc.creator: Crow Wing County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Crow Wing County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Cuyuna Iron Range Heritage Network (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Crow Wing County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Cuyuna Iron Range Heritage Network is a non-profit organization located in Crosby, Minnesota and staffed entirely by volunteers. Our goal is to preserve the history of the Cuyuna Iron Range. We also operate the Soo Line Depot Museum in Crosby, Minnesota. Our members have written and published nine research books and two novels on the Cuyuna Iron Range and vicinity.  Our photographs and postcards in Minnesota Reflections depict the early Crosby area from 1910 to the 1930s, including images of transportation, business, local architecture and people.
oclcdc.creator: Cuyuna Iron Range Heritage Network
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images may be governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact Cuyuna Iron Range Heritage Network for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Dakota County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Dakota County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Dakota County Historical Society in South St. Paul, Minnesota, preserves historic sites, and collects photographs (more than 11,000) and artifacts (more than 25,000) that tell the story of the origins and development of Dakota County. The historical society contributed images to Minnesota Reflections that show the changes that took place in the county before 1909.
oclcdc.creator: Dakota County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Dakota County Historical Society.

set.setName: Division of State Library Services, Minnesota Department of Education

oclcdc.title: Division of State Library Services, Minnesota Department of Education (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota state library agency is a division of the Minnesota Department of Education. The state library agency provides leadership and support to the Minnesota library community in planning, developing and implementing high quality library and information services statewide. State Library Services administers federal and state grants-in-aid programs for libraries. The collection in Minnesota Reflections consists of the biennial reports of the Minnesota state library agency from 1899 to 1924.
oclcdc.creator: Division of State Library Services, Minnesota Department of Education
oclcdc.rights: These are Minnesota state government documents and in the public domain, and available for use by members of the public.

oclcdc.title: Dodge County Extension (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Dodge County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Dodge County Extension, part of the University of Minnesota Extension, provides research-based, scientific information to the residents of Dodge County. The collection of the Annual Reports of the County Extension Agent in Dodge County, Minnesota spans the years 1923 to 1982. The reports, now housed in the Extension Regional Office in Rochester, Minnesota, highlight the work of Extension staff in agricultural production and management, family consumer sciences, and 4-H youth development. They include names of families involved in extension programs, photographs of agricultural production efforts, maps, and summaries of educational programs conducted by Dodge County Extension staff. The collection offers a unique perspective on rural living and changes in agricultural production practices during a 59-year period.
oclcdc.creator: Dodge County Extension
oclcdc.rights: Use of these documents is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. These documents are the property of the University of Minnesota. Please contact the Copyright Coordinator, University of Minnesota Extension, 405 Coffey Hall, St. Paul, MN, 55108-6068, for permission to publish this document.

oclcdc.title: Dodge County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Dodge County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Dodge County Historical Society (DCHS) is dedicated to collecting, preserving, and disseminating knowledge about the history of Dodge County and its relation to the history of the State of Minnesota. DCHS contributed to Minnesota Reflections Dodge County Atlases, or plat books, from 1894, 1905, and 1915.
oclcdc.creator: Dodge County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Dodge County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Douglas County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Douglas County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: From its offices in the early 1900s home of Minnesota statesman Knute Nelson in Alexandria, Minnesota, the Douglas County Historical Society preserves photographs, objects and structures that tell the history of this Central Minnesota county. They contributed to Minnesota Reflections scenes from the early development of the resort and lake industry in Douglas County.
oclcdc.creator: Douglas County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: All Rights Reserved, Douglas County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Duluth Public Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Duluth Public Library consists of a main downtown library and two branches in the city. The library was founded in 1890. The Duluth Collection, housed on the top floor of the main library in the North Shore Room, contains documents reflecting Duluth’s history. The library’s Reference area also maintains historical newspaper clipping files and biography files, Duluth city directories, local newspapers, and other local history resources. The library contributed to Minnesota Reflections atlases, maps, and books that record and reflect the early history of Duluth and Northeastern Minnesota.
oclcdc.creator: Duluth Public Library
oclcdc.rights: Please contact the Duluth Public Library for permission to use.

oclcdc.title: Esko Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Carlton County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Esko Hisotrical Society in Esko, Minnesota serves the citizens of northeastern Minnesota by collecting photographs, printed materials, and artifacts related to the history of the Esko-Thomson Township area. The society is housed in the museum in Esko, which includes seven historic buildings. Its goal is to share the past through the stories and artifacts of those who settled in and made the community what it is today. The Esko Historical Society contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes photographs of the people, farms, and roads, as well as artwork done by early residents to show how people lived as they settled and developed the Esko area.
oclcdc.creator: Esko Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images may be governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact the Esko Historical Society for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Excelsior-Lake Minnetonka Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Excelsior-Lake Minnetonka Historical Society (ELMHS) is dedicated to collecting, preserving, and educating people about the history of the city of Excelsior, Minnesota. We fulfill this mission through our many collections, which include family files, house files, personal diaries, and other historical documents. ELMHS has contributed to Minnesota Reflections images from our Excelsior Amusement Park collection. The park was in operation from 1924-1974, and included rides such as the roller coaster, caterpillar, tilt-a-world, carousel, and Ferris wheel.
oclcdc.creator: Excelsior-Lake Minnetonka Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Excelsior-Lake Minnetonka Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Faribault County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Faribault County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Faribault County Historical Society, with headquarters in Blue Earth, Minnesota, offers artifacts, photographs and images showing the development of the county, which was first settled in 1856. The society operates its museum in the house of James Wakefield, and also supports the Etta C. Ross memorial library built in 1904, and the Episcopal Church of the Good Shepherd, which has the first stained glass window west of the Mississippi. It operates a historical village at the Faribault County fairgrounds. The contributions to Minnesota Reflections show rural life and development of the south central rural area highlighting farming and expansion of the railroads.
oclcdc.creator: Faribault County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the expressed written consent of the Faribault County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Fillmore County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Fillmore County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Fillmore County Historical Society in Fountain, Minnesota, collects photographs and artifacts related to the history of Fillmore County, which is one of the oldest counties in the state and is located in the southeastern part of Minnesota on the Iowa border. The historical society shared with Minnesota Reflections images of the early development of the county including milling, woolen and creamery industries, and photographs of the fire department, churches, the courthouse and the county poor house.
oclcdc.creator: Fillmore County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Fillmore County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Freeborn County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Freeborn County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Freeborn County Historical Society in Albert Lee, Minnesota, supports a library, museum and historical village. The society contributed a photograph of the county courthouse to Minnesota Reflections.
oclcdc.creator: Freeborn County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: This image may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Freeborn County Historical Museum.

oclcdc.title: Geological Society of Minnesota (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Geological Society of Minnesota (GSM) is a public-spirited, nonprofit educational organization that has been in operation since 1938.  Its mission is to promote public interest and supply educational support in the geological sciences, by sponsoring free lectures and labs at the University of Minnesota, conducting statewide and regional field trips, holding classroom presentations for schools, maintaining a media library, publishing relevant information for public distribution, and maintaining and expanding upon a series of geological markers located throughout the state. The GSM contribution to Minnesota Reflections consists of nearly 2,000 pages of newsletters published since 1943, which provide general information on recent and forthcoming association activity, as well as biographies and memorials for society members.
oclcdc.creator: Geological Society of Minnesota
oclcdc.rights: No restrictions on use. Please credit the Geological Society of Minnesota when used.

set.setName: Girl Scout Council of Minnesota and Wisconsin River Valleys

oclcdc.title: Girl Scout Council of Minnesota and Wisconsin River Valleys (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Girl Scout Council of Minnesota and Wisconsin River Valleys, formed in 2007 from five legacy councils in Minnesota, serves girls in 44 Minnesota counties, as well as four counties in Wisconsin and one in Iowa. The River Valleys Archival Collection reflects the early history of Girl Scouting through its uniform and handbook collections, photographs, program materials, correspondence and newsletters.  The Girl Scout Council of Minnesota and Wisconsin River Valleys’ contribitions to Minnesota Reflections share their early history through very early photographs, programs and music, as well as original correspondence from Juliette Gordon Low, founder of Girl Scouts USA.
oclcdc.creator: Girl Scout Council of Minnesota and Wisconsin River Valleys
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images may be governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact Girl Scouts of Minnesota and Wisconsin River Valleys for permission to use.

oclcdc.title: Goodhue County Historical Society
oclcdc.subject: Goodhue County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Goodhue County Historical Society was founded in 1869 and is the oldest county historical society in Minnesota. Located in Red Wing, Minnesota, the historical society preserves and interprets the natural and cultural history of this southeastern county. They contributed to Minnesota Reflections images from the Reinhold J. Kosec photograph collection, including images of agriculture, industry, sports, military, schools, parks, homes, river scenes and early street scenes.
oclcdc.creator: Goodhue County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Goodhue County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Grant County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Grant County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Grant County Historical Society in Elbow Lake, Minnesota, collects and preserves artifacts and archival materials related to this west central Minnesota county. The society supports genealogical research with its many historical resources. Exhibits in our museum reflect our Scandinavian ancestry and pioneer life. The Veterans' Memorial Hall honors veterans from the Civil War to the present. The 1900 and 1914 Grant County plat books are now a part of the Minnesota Reflections collection.
oclcdc.creator: Grant County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these documents and images are governed by U.S. and International copyright laws. Documents and images are the property of the Grant County Historical Society. Please contact the Grant County Historical Society for written permission to reproduce.

oclcdc.title: Gustavus Adolphus College (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Nicollet County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Gustavus Adolphus College is home to the collections of The College Archives and The Lutheran Church Archives. Gustavus Adolphus College archives contributed documents and images illustrating the growth of this educational institution from a parochial school for immigrant Swedish children in Red Wing, to St. Ansgar's Academy in Carver County, to a liberal arts college in St. Peter, Minnesota. The Lutheran Church Archives contributed images from the Lutheran Minnesota Conference (1858-1962), the Red River Valley Conference (1912-1962) of the Augustana Lutheran Church, the Minnesota and Red River synods of the Lutheran Church in America (1963-1987) and the English Evangelical Lutheran Synod of the Northwest (1891-1962), showing scenes of Swedish immigrant activities across Minnesota.
oclcdc.creator: Gustavus Adolphus College
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Gustavus Adolphus College.

oclcdc.title: Hamline University (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: University Archives at Hamline University collects and preserves university records, publications, photographs, audiotapes, films, artifacts, and other materials from the university's early days in Red Wing (1854-1869) to its present in St. Paul, Minnesota. For Minnesota Reflections, the archives contributed images of presidents, faculty, students, athletics and other activities, and the university and its Saint Paul neighborhood.
oclcdc.creator: Hamline University
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the written consent of the Hamline University Archives, Hamline University, 1356 Hewitt Avenue, Saint Paul, MN 55104; 651-523-2080; archives@hamline.edu.

oclcdc.title: Hazelden Foundation (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Chisago County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Hazelden, a national nonprofit organization founded in 1949, helps people reclaim their lives from the disease of addiction. With nearly 60 years of knowledge and experience, Hazelden's comprehensive approach to addiction addresses the full range of patient, family, and professional needs, including treatment and continuing care for youth and adults, research, higher learning, public education and advocacy, and publishing. Hazelden's contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes photographs of the early buildings and of the people who helped shape Hazelden's education and publishing programs, and its unique "Minnesota Model" of addiction treatment.
oclcdc.creator: Hazelden Foundation
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of Hazelden Foundation.

set.setName: Hennepin County Department of Public Affairs

oclcdc.title: Hennepin County Department of Public Affairs (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Hennepin County Department of Public Affairs is the public communications office of the Hennepin County government. As part of its mission, Hennepin County Public Affairs creates and maintains images of this government organization's work and images of events in county life. Images contributed by Public Affairs to Minnesota Reflections cover a wide ranges of Hennepin County's service to the public, including library activities, criminal justice images, law enforcement, construction projects and technology, and significant events in Hennepin County history.
oclcdc.creator: Hennepin County Department of Public Affairs
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact the Hennepin County Department of Public Affairs for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Hennepin County Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Hennepin County Library is comprised of 41 branches located throughout Minnesota's most populous county. Together the system's collections total more than five million items in 40 languages. The James K. Hosmer Special Collections Library at the Central Library in downtown Minneapolis houses a vast collection of Minneapolis history materials, a selection of which the library has contributed to Minnesota Reflections. Highlights of the digital collections include the 19th-century diary of a Minneapolis teenager, three plat books, dozens of maps, three menus from the city's historic hotels, and hundreds of photographs that document the city's late nineteenth and early twentieth-century history.
oclcdc.creator: Hennepin County Library
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Hennepin County Library.

oclcdc.title: Hennepin History Museum (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Hennepin History Museum in Minneapolis, Minnesota, is home to the Hennepin County Historical Society, which preserves the history of Minnesota's most populous county. The museum presents exhibits and scholarly collections in the historic George Christian mansion. The more than 480 images the Hennepin History Museum contributed to Minnesota Reflections show the early history and development at St. Anthony Falls, including construction at the power company and scenes of the flour milling industry, which was central to the economic development of Minneapolis. The photographs were taken between 1885 and 1906.
oclcdc.creator: Hennepin History Museum
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Hennepin History Museum.

oclcdc.title: Hennepin County Medical Center History Museum (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Hennepin County Medical Center History Museum, located in the HCMC campus in downtown Minneapolis, collects, preserves and interprets the history of Minneapolis and Hennepin County's large public hospital. Their collections include photographs, documents, uniforms and medical equipment from every department of the hospital, from the laundry to the emergency room. For Minnesota Reflections, the museum shared photographs of the dynamic life of the early hospital, founded as City Hospital in 1887 and renamed Minneapolis General Hospital in 1920.
oclcdc.creator: Hennepin County Medical Center History Museum
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the HCMC History Museum.

oclcdc.title: Heritage Group North (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Pine River County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Heritage Group North, Inc. (HGN) is an independent nonprofit organization based in Pine River, Minnesota. The mission of HGN is to gather, protect, interpret, and share history relevant to the greater Pine River area. Through programs, publications, and other activities, HGN seeks to promote public appreciation of the past, preserve community identity, and stimulate heritage tourism. This all-volunteer organization relies on membership, grants, and the generosity of the public to accomplish its goals. Heritage Group North has contributed to Minnesota Reflections photos and postcards of scenes of Pine River and surrounding area and early editions of the Pine River Journal that were never microfilmed.
oclcdc.creator: Heritage Group North
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Contact Heritage Group North for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Iron Range Research Center (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Iron Range Research Center is the library and archiving division of Ironworld Discovery Center in Chisholm, Minnesota, a historical museum founded in 1977. The mission of the research center is to collect, preserve and interpret the history of Minnesota's iron ranges and the people who settled in this northeastern region of the state. The Iron Range Research Center contributed more than 370 images to Minnesota Reflections. Many of the photographs show the history and development of iron industry on Mesabi Iron Range. Others show the lumber industry, railroads and town development in the area.
oclcdc.creator: Iron Range Research Center
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright law. Please contact the Iron Range Research Center, Chisholm, MN, for more information in regard to these images, online at http://mndiscoverycenter.com/research-center/archive

oclcdc.title: Jackson County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Jackson County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Jackson County Historical Society is headquartered at the museum located in Lakefield, Minnesota. Their motto is "Preserving yesterday and today, for tomorrow!" Documentation of the history of the county is on-going through the collection of artifacts, photographs and stories. The photographs submitted to Minnesota Reflections are a sampling of many photographs documenting the colorful 150 year history of Jackson County.
oclcdc.creator: Jackson County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the express written consent of the Jackson County Historical Society.

set.setName: Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest

oclcdc.title: Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest collects, preserves and interprets records, photographs and artifacts representing the experiences of Jewish people and the Jewish community in the Upper Midwest. The collections chronicle the building of Jewish culture, social services, labor, agricultural and religious organizations, and Jewish contributions to greater Minnesota. Our materials are housed at the Minneapolis Jewish Community Center and Elmer L. Andersen Library at the University of Minnesota. JHSUM contributed more than 470 photos from 1910 to 1950 to Minnesota Reflections. Jewish shops, businesspeople, camps, social organizations, religious holiday celebrations, Hebrew schools, synagogue buildings, neighborhood locations and sports teams are a few of the areas featured.
oclcdc.creator: Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest.

oclcdc.title: Kandiyohi County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Kandiyohi County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Kandiyohi County Historical Society, in Willmar, Minnesota, collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to Kandiyohi County. The society supports genealogical research with a wide range of historical resources. The Kandiyohi County Historical Society contributed to Minnesota Reflections early plat books from 1886 and 1900.
oclcdc.creator: Kandiyohi County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without permission from the Kandiyohi County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Lake County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Lake County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Lake County Historical Society, in Two Harbors, Minnesota, collects photographs and artifacts and preserves buildings, such as the Two Harbors Light Station, that tell the history of Lake County in Minnesota's arrowhead region. The historical society contributed to Minnesota Reflections images taken between 1883 and 1909 of the building of wooden iron ore docks in Two Harbors.
oclcdc.creator: Lake County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Lake County Historical Society.

set.setName: Lake of the Woods Historical Society

oclcdc.title: Lake of the Woods Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Lake of the Woods County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: From Baudette, Minnesota, in the youngest and most northern county in the state, the Lake of the Woods County Historical Society serves as a repository for photographs, printed materials and artifacts that relate to the history of the Lake of the Woods area. The images the historical society contributed to Minnesota Reflections depict the area during settlement days, capture scenes from the devastating forest fire of 1910, and reflect early industries and development.
oclcdc.creator: Lake of the Woods Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Lake of the Woods County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Lincoln County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Lincoln County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Lincoln County Historical Society Museum is housed in a six-building complex near the shores of Lake Hendricks in Hendricks, Minnesota. Established in 1967, the society's purpose is to preserve the history of Lincoln County to pay homage to our pioneer ancestors for the benefit of our present and future citizens. Through historical artifacts, documents, and photographs, memories of our past are preserved and maintained for the enjoyment and study by anyone interested in the heritage of Lincoln County. The Lincoln County Historical Society contributed to Minnesota Reflections a collection of photographs depicting people, places, organizations, and activities from the earliest years of the 20th century in Lincoln County.
oclcdc.creator: Lincoln County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images may be governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact the Lincoln County Historical Society for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Luther Seminary (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Luther Seminary Archives, St. Paul, Minnesota, includes material from all of its predecessor schools which, over a period of many years and several mergers, form the current institution. These predecessors include Augsburg Seminary (Lutheran Free Church), Red Wing Seminary (Hauge Synod), United Seminary (United Church), Luther Theological Seminary (Norwegian Synod), and Northwestern Seminary. All have contributed records to this large collection of papers, photographs, audio and video material, oral histories, and objects. Photographs for the Minnesota Reflections project represent all of the predecessor schools and document church, academic, and ethnic culture among Minnesota's Scandinavian people.
oclcdc.creator: Luther Seminary
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the express written consent of the Luther Seminary Archives.

oclcdc.title: Macalester College (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Macalester College archive collection includes photographs and documents related to the history of this St. Paul, Minnesota, college since its beginnings in 1885. Macalester College contributed photographs to Minnesota Reflections that show scenes from the early development of the college and the development of the Summit Avenue area of St Paul.
oclcdc.creator: Macalester College
oclcdc.rights: Images are available for educational and research purposes. These images may not be reproduced for commercial purposes without the express written consent of Macalester College. Macalester College Archives 651-696-6901

oclcdc.title: Martin County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Martin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Martin County Historical Society, located at the Pioneer Museum in Fairmont, Minnesota, contains artifacts, historical documents, and pictures relating to county history dating back to the mid-1800s. The society presents special programs for K-12 students and the public throughout the year. Their contributions to Minnesota Reflections consist of photographs of the county including street scenes, unique and historic buildings, lake scenes, and agricultural images that reflect the historic development of the county. The addition of historic maps and plat books provides additional historic perspectives of Martin County.
oclcdc.creator: Martin County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Martin County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: McLeod County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: McLeod County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The McLeod County Historical Society in Hutchinson, Minnesota, is dedicated to connecting with the past, understanding the present and making informed choices about the future by finding, preserving, explaining and sharing McLeod County History. Along with an extensive exhibit area and art gallery, their building houses a document and photograph archive. Preserving local history has been an important undertaking in McLeod County since the old settlers gathered in the late 19th century to share their stories. McLeod County Historical Society contributed 90 photographs to Minnesota Reflections that represent the towns of the county and show a variety of early street scenes, local businesses and homes.
oclcdc.creator: McLeod County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: All rights owned by McLeod County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Melrose Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Melrose Area Historical Society was incorporated in 1987 to preserve, interpret, and disseminate information about the Melrose School District area.  The Melrose Area Museum moved from two small locations to its present one, a former convent, in 1998. Refurbishment resulted in two floors of display space and one of storage. It displays and interprets thousands of artifacts, family histories, maps, pictures and documents.  Among its many projects was the placing of a marker on the grave of Edwin Clark, \\"Father of Melrose.\\" The Melrose Area Historical Society worked with the Minnesota Digital Library to digitize for Minnesota Reflections photos and original letters from Edwin Clark to his wife, Ellen, and from her to Edwin from the 1850s and 1860s.
oclcdc.creator: Melrose Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images may be governed by U.S. and international copyright law. Please contact the Melrose Area Historical Society for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Mesabi Range College Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Mesabi Range College Library, at the Mesabi Range Community & Technical College located in Virginia, Minnesota, holds an Archive Collection which houses historical documents such as college publications, news articles and photographs relevant to the history of the college from its founding in 1923 as the Virginia Junior College. From its Archive Collection, Mesabi Range College Library contributed to Minnesota Reflections historical documents, public records, and photographs of the City of Virginia and of Iron Range industries such as mining and logging, dating from 1924 through 1945.
oclcdc.creator: Mesabi Range Community & Technical College
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Images are property of the Mesabi Range Community College Library. Please contact the Mesabi Range Community College Library for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Milaca Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Mille Lacs County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Milaca Area Historical Society, in Milaca, Minnesota, collects, preserves and disseminates knowledge about the history of the Milaca area and Mille Lacs County. The goals of the society are to locate, collect and preserve material which may help to establish or illustrate the history of the Milaca area, to provide the public with access to available historical information, and to arouse and sustain interest in our past. For Minnesota Reflections, the Milaca area Historical Society contributed its 1914 Mille Lacs County plat book.
oclcdc.creator: Milaca Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright law. Please contact the Milaca Area Historical Society for further information. P.O. Box 144 Milaca, MN 56353.

oclcdc.title: Mille Lacs County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Mille Lacs County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Mille Lacs County Historical Society, in Princeton, Minnesota collects, preserves and disseminates knowledge about the history of the Mille Lacs County. The society collects and preserves any material that may help to establish or illustrate the history of Mille Lacs County and makes available historical information that arouses and sustains interest in our past. For Minnesota Reflections, the Mille Lacs County Historical Society contributed photos from around the area.
oclcdc.creator: Mille Lacs County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written permission of the Mille Lacs County Historical Society.

set.setName: Minnesota Annual Conference of the United Methodist Church

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Annual Conference of the United Methodist Church (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota Annual Conference of The United Methodist Church is the regional organization of United Methodist congregations in Minnesota. The Conference Archive, in Minneapolis, Minnesota holds records, publications, photographs, audiotapes, films, artifacts and other materials from the 150-year history of the organization. The collection documents the history of the predecessors of the United Methodist Church; the Methodist Church, the Evangelical Church, and the United Brethren in Christ. For Minnesota Reflections, the archive contributed 60 photographs that offer a glimpse of life in late 19th century and early 20th century at colleges, the State Fair, churches, and summer camps as well as church buildings with many different architectural styles typical of the time period.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Annual Conference of the United Methodist Church
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the written consent of the Minnesota Annual Conference United Methodist Church.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Department of Health (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The R. N. Barr Library at the Minnesota Department of Health in St. Paul, Minnesota has an extensive collection of public health books, journals, and videos, and presently provides lending, reference, inter-library loan and other services to Minnesota's public health professionals, school health practitioners, and employees of the Minnesota Board of Nursing and the Minnesota Department of Human Services. The Barr Library has contributed the State Board of Health Reports for the years of 1872-1882 (Reports 1-3 and 5-9) to Minnesota Reflections.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Department of Health
oclcdc.rights: These reports may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Minnesota Department of Health.

set.setName: Minnesota Department of Natural Resources - Division of Forestry

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Department of Natural Resources - Division of Forestry (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Through shared information, technology, and understanding, the Department of Natural Resources Division of Forestry empowers others and themselves to: sustain and enhance functioning forest ecosystems; provide a sustainable supply of forest resources to meet human needs; protect lives and property from wildfire; and provide a dollar return to the permanent school trust. This is accomplished through three core programs: fire management, state land management, and cooperative forest management. The annual reports contributed by the Division of Forestry to Minnesota Reflections highlight the formation and evolution of the division in its early years and share information on the need for natural resource management.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Department of Natural Resources - Division of Forestry
oclcdc.rights: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources (DNR) claims copyright on all intellectual property created by the department. For commercial uses, including print publications, publication on other websites or in other formats or media, permission is required. Contact the DNR Information Center at info.dnr@state.mn.us.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Department of Transportation (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: This library, located in St. Paul, Minnesota is primarily a technical library providing information services to the Minnesota Department of Transportation. It also provides transportation-related information services to the state's city and county engineers, other transportation practitioners and citizens of the state. It's collections hold a limited amount of historic information primarily relating to the department and the development of highways in the state.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Department of Transportation
oclcdc.rights: These images may be reproduced without permission.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Geological Survey (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota Geological Survey, part of the Winchell School of Earth Sciences Institute of Technology, at the University of Minnesota, is the state's primary center for earth sciences information. established in 1872. The Survey conducts basic and applied geological research - chiefly through geologic mapping - conveys that information to the public through publications and service activities, and promotes earth science education. Minnesota is its exclusive focus. The Minnesota Geological Survey contribution to Minnesota Reflections consists of more than 600 images of maps published separately or as part of reports from 1872 until the present.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Geological Survey
oclcdc.rights: Public domain. We request that if the images are used, credit be given to the Minnesota Geological Survey, University of Minnesota.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota Historical Society, headquartered in St. Paul, Minnesota was established in 1849 to collect, preserve, and tell the story of Minnesota's past. Its extensive collections of printed materials, photographs, manuscripts, government records, maps, artifacts, and audio and video materials document the entire spectrum of Minnesota's history and pre-history. The Minnesota Historical Society's contributions to Minnesota Reflections include Minnesota's original land survey plats, several 19th century atlases and plat books, speeches and other items extolling the state's wealth and prospects, and a contrasting selection of letters and reports that document natural disasters and disaster relief.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: http://www.mnhs.org/mhsuse.html

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Legislative Reference Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota Legislative Reference Library in St. Paul, Minnesota has supplied unbiased information to support the legislative process for more than 35 years. The Library's collection focuses on public policy materials including state government documents, consultants' reports and newspaper resources. The library also collects primary legislative materials including House and Senate committee minutes and hearings. The library contributed photographs to Minnesota Reflections of legislators serving Minnesota in 1913 and 1949 supplied from Minnesota Legislative Manuals. A recently launched database with biographical information on all current and former members of the Minnesota Legislature includes additional information on each of the legislators.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Legislative Reference Library
oclcdc.rights: No Restrictions.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Legislature -- State Revisor's Office (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Office of the Revisor of Statutes, created by statute in 1939, is an office of the Minnesota Legislature located in St. Paul, Minnesota. Staff members provide confidential, nonpartisan drafting services to both the House and the Senate, as well as the governor, constitutional officers, state agencies and departments. In addition, the Revisor's office is the official publisher of Minnesota law, including the Laws of Minnesota, Minnesota Statutes, and Minnesota Rules. These Minnesota laws are published in books and on the Internet. Specific duties of the office are set out in Minnesota Statutes, chapters 3C and 14.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Legislature -- State Revisor's Office
oclcdc.rights: Copyright, State of Minnesota, Revisor's Office.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Museum of Mining (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota Museum of Mining in Chisholm, Minnesota was established in 1953 on 15 acres within a walled sports complex built as a 1930s WPA project. Located on the Mesabi Iron Range, the museum houses a steam locomotive and shovel, large pieces of mining equipment, haul trucks, fire trucks, a replica underground mine drift, a steam railroad diorama by artist F. Lee Jaques, and exhibits from early life in a mining town. The images contributed to Minnesota Reflections illustrate miners and their equipment, mine safety, lowering a mule into an underground mine, and construction of the WPA-era sports complex.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Museum of Mining
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the express written consent of the Minnesota Museum of Mining.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Newspapers Collection (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota Digital Library is now providing access to some of Minnesota's historical newspapers. We are focusing our attention on titles, volumes and issues that were never microfilmed, and where the originals are frail and not frequently available to the public.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Digital Library
oclcdc.rights: Rights to these digitized newspapers vary by newspaper title.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota State Law Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota State Law Library in St. Paul, Minnesota, collects state and federal legal materials, and is the oldest continuing library in Minnesota. The Library and the Territory of Minnesota were created by the same act of Congress on March 3, 1849. Documents included in the State Law Library contributions to Minnesota Reflections are the handwritten first Rules of Court for Minnesota, the Republican and Democratic versions of the Minnesota Constitutional debates and other early Minnesota legal materials.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota State Law Library
oclcdc.rights: No Restrictions.

oclcdc.title: Minnesota State University, Mankato (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Blue Earth County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: University Archives at Minnesota State University, Mankato collects and preserves records, documents and photographs related to the development of the institution from its early days of the Mankato State Normal School. The university collaborates with the Southern Minnesota Historical Center to document life in the south central region of the state. Minnesota State University, Mankato contributed to Minnesota Reflections images of the development of Mankato State Normal School including school presidents, faculty, students, and athletics.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota State University, Mankato
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images are governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Images are property of Minnesota State University, Mankato. Visit our website for additional details. http://www.lib.mnsu.edu/lib/archives/copyright&fees.html

oclcdc.title: Minnesota Streetcar Museum (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The mission of the Minnesota Streetcar Museum in Minneapolis, Minnesota is to preserve and communicate to the public the experience of Minnesota's electric street and interurban railway history. It has restored a number of historic Minnesota streetcars and operates them for the public at Lake Harriet in Minneapolis and at Excelsior. It also produces a quarterly magazine on Minnesota streetcar history and maintains an archive of about 10,000 photos. The photos submitted to Minnesota Reflections show all aspects of the operations of streetcars in the state, with an emphasis on the Twin Cities of Minneapolis and St. Paul.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Streetcar Museum
oclcdc.rights: Contact the Minnesota Streetcar Museum for permission to use.

oclcdc.title: Morrison County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Morrison County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Morrison County Historical Society is a nonprofit organization devoted to preserving artifacts and historical information regarding Morrison County, and to educating the public about that history. MCHS owns and operates The Charles A. Weyerhaeuser Memorial Museum in Little Falls, Minnesota. MCHS contributed the county's 1892 plat book to Minnesota Reflections.
oclcdc.creator: Morrison County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these publications is governed by U.S. and international copyright law. Please contact the Morrison County Historical Society for further information, PO Box 239, Little Falls, MN 56345.

oclcdc.title: Mower County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Mower County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Mower County Historical Society has been collecting photos, artifacts and information related to Mower County history since 1947. Our collection is housed in 21 buildings located at the east end of Mower County Fairgrounds in Austin, Minnesota. Our resources include an extensive research library, allowing researchers of local history and genealogy many sources of information. Our contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes the 1896 Standard Atlas of Mower County and the 1949 Aerial Views of the county showing geographic features, farming traits, churches, schools and transportation routes in Mower County.
oclcdc.creator: Mower County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These materials may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Mower County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Murray County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Murray County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Murray County Historical Society in Slayton, Minnesota is a non-profit organization dedicated to the collection, preservation, interpretation and dissemination of the county's history. Established in 1934, the society operates the Murray County Historical Museum, the Sierk Building, dedicated to the agricultural heritage of the county, and the Wornson Log Cabin, built in 1872. Newly purchased by the county and given to the society is the Dinehart/Holt House, built in 1891, which is now on the National Register of Historic Places. Our contribution to Minnesota Reflections is 200 photographs depicting the nine towns in the county in their early years.
oclcdc.creator: Murray County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images are the property of the Murray County Historical Society, Slayton, MN.

oclcdc.title: New Brighton Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The New Brighton Area Historical Society, located in Ramsey County, Minnesota collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to New Brighton, Arden Hills, and Mounds View, and has compiled them into three hardcover books, published in 1987, 2002, and 2005. The Society operates the New Brighton History Museum in the 1887 Bulwer Junction Depot, located in Long Lake Regional Park. The New Brighton Area Historical Society contributed 118 images to Minnesota Reflections that show the history of the area through early street scenes, business and industry, schools, churches, railroads, local events, and portraits.
oclcdc.creator: New Brighton Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the New Brighton Area Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: New Prague Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Scott County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The New Prague Area Historical Society is housed in the Paul Komarek Room of the New Prague Community Library in New Prague, Minnesota. Located a short distance south of the Minnesota River Valley and the Twin Cities, New Prague rests within the rolling hills of a rich agricultural region. Founded in 1856 by Bohemian, German and Irish families, New Prague continues to retain its ethnic identity and traditions. Professional and lay photographers have recorded the daily lives of people and the events of the community as early as 1870. Images provided to Minnesota Reflections from our collection record the development of Main Street and the active milling and farming industries that shaped the community.
oclcdc.creator: New Prague Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images cannot be reproduced without the permission of the New Prague Area Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: New Richland Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Waseca County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The New Richland Area Historical Society was formed in 2001, one year before the 125th anniversary of the town's founding. The society collects historic pictures, articles and other items from the community and displays this collection during the town's annual celebration, Farm and City Days, during the second week of July. A most recent donation was glass slides of photographs shown before movies at Faust Theater from about 1914 to 1940. It is this collection of slides that the New Richland Historical Society has provided to Minnesota Reflections.
oclcdc.creator: New Richland Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Please contact the New Richland Area Historical Society for permission to publish these images. .

oclcdc.title: Nicollet County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Nicollet County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: From its home in the Treaty Site History Center, the Nicollet County Historical Society in St. Peter, Minnesota, preserves the past of this south central Minnesota county by collecting census records, maps, artifacts and photographs. The Nicollet County Historical Society's Minnesota Reflections project includes images related to the Minnesota River Valley, the St. Peter State Hospital, area businesses and agriculture, and the county's many communities.
oclcdc.creator: Nicollet County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written permission of the Nicollet County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Nobles County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Nobles County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Nobles County Historical Society, based out of the War Memorial Building in Worthington, Minnesota, promotes, develops and interprets the history of Nobles County and its people. In fulfilling its mission, the society collects documents, manuscripts, photographs and three-dimensional objects, including those from contiguous areas that interact with the county. The Society also operates a Pioneer Village typical of small communities in the Midwest at the beginning of the 20th Century. The Society contributed more than 150 images to Minnesota Reflections showing agriculture, business and labor, education, recreation, leisure and transportation from within Nobles County.
oclcdc.creator: Nobles County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Nobles County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Norseland Lutheran Church (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Nicollet County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Norseland Lutheran Church, located in Nicollet County, Minnesota, was organized in 1858. The first resident pastor served Norwegian Lutherans in an area of 16 counties in Minnesota. Images contributed to Minnesota Reflections include photographs of Reverend Thomas Johnsen and the congregation which he served at Norseland along with the Herbjorn Gausta altar painting.
oclcdc.creator: Norseland Lutheran Church
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of Norseland Lutheran Church.

set.setName: North Star Museum of Boy Scouting and Girl Scouting

oclcdc.title: North Star Museum of Boy Scouting and Girl Scouting (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The North Star Museum of Boy Scouting and Girl Scouting is a 30-year-old institution, founded by Boy Scout adult volunteers in the 1970s. Their goal was to collect the material remains of their Scouting experiences. Since then, the collection has grown to represent Boy Scouting and Girl Scouting in the five-state upper Midwest region, and includes some 150,000 artifacts: uniforms, patches, accoutrements, films, video, audiotape and photographs. It opened in its own building in April 2006 in North St. Paul, Minnesota. The Museum collects, preserves, displays, and shares the history of Boy Scouting, Girl Scouting, and Girl Guiding.
oclcdc.creator: North Star Museum of Boy Scouting and Girl Scouting
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the written consent of the North Star Museum.

oclcdc.title: Northeast Minnesota Historical Center (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The University of Minnesota Duluth Library’s Northeast Minnesota Historical Center is a regional history archive. The Center collects photographs, maps, manuscripts, family letters and other documents that tell the story of the development of the city of Duluth and Minnesota's four northeast counties - St. Louis, Lake, Cook and Carlton. The center has contributed nearly 2,800 images to Minnesota Reflections,including images from the Paul B. Gaylord collection, which depict the earliest development of downtown Duluth, the Louis P. Gallagher studio featuring early panoramas of Duluth harbor and the work of photographers that captured images of the lumber industry. Project images include the landscape work of George A. Newton.
oclcdc.creator: Northeast Minnesota Historical Center
oclcdc.rights: Contact NEMHC for permission to use images.

oclcdc.title: Northfield Arts Guild (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Rice County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Northfield Arts Guild was founded in 1959 by people wanting to create a place for community-based art making in theater, dance, music, literary and visual arts. More than 50 years later, the Arts Guild owns two buildings, produces more than 70 annual art events and conducts 30 weekly art classes. The Arts Guild also plays a leadership role in city-wide initiatives to promote Northfield as an arts destination. The Arts Guild on-site archive is extensive and open for public viewing. The Arts Guild’s contributions to Minnesota Reflections contains a selection of documents from the first 10 years of the organization.
oclcdc.creator: Northfield Arts Guild
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Northfield Arts Guild.

oclcdc.title: Northfield Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Rice County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Northfield Historical Society, located in historic downtown Northfield, Minnesota, was founded in 1975 and is committed to being the primary community resource that honors, preserves and interprets Northfield's unique place in history, building a bridge from its past to its future. The images submitted to Minnesota Reflections showcase Northfield history from the early 1850s to the late 1940s. The images look at historic downtown Northfield, some early pioneers in Northfield, the attempted raid by the James-Younger Gang, and St. Olaf College and Carleton College. There are some amazing weather pictures including a snow storm in 1888 that dumped three feet of snow in Northfield.
oclcdc.creator: Northfield Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Northfield Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Northfield Public Library (Digital collections)
oclcdc.subject: Rice County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Northfield Public Library began in 1856 with a reading room and a circulating library set up by the Lyceum Society. The library is located in an expanded Carnegie building in the heart of downtown Northfield and plays a vital role in preserving the history of Northfield.
