The local history collection includes books, atlases, plat maps, school yearbooks, scrapbooks, newspaper and census microfilm, clippings, family histories, and more.  The library’s  contribution  to Minnesota Reflections includes  three maps of Northfield from 1855, 1869 and 1968 and the Sept. 14, 1876, Rice County Journal, the day of the attempted bank raid in Northfield by the James-Younger Gang.
oclcdc.creator: Northfield Public Library
oclcdc.rights: Use of these objects is governed by U.S. and International copyright. Contact the Northfield Public Library for permission to use these objects.

oclcdc.title: Northwest Minnesota Historical Center (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Established in 1972 on the campus of Minnesota State University Moorhead, the Northwest Minnesota Historical Center collects and preserves information concerning the history and culture of the Red River Valley of the North. The holdings of the center consist of correspondence, diaries, newspapers, business records, oral interviews, photographs and other materials related to the history and culture of northwestern Minnesota. The Northwest Minnesota Historical Center contributed to Minnesota Reflections photographs by Haakon Bjornaas, whose work from 1907 to 1912 documented many communities in the Red River Valley, and letters sent to Henry Peterson, a rural Clay County farmer, by former German prisoners of war who between 1943 and 1945 worked on Peterson's truck farm as laborers.
oclcdc.creator: Northwest Minnesota Historical Center
oclcdc.rights: Reproduce only with permission of Northwest Minnesota Historical Center.

oclcdc.title: Olmsted County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Olmsted County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Olmsted County Historical Society in Rochester, Minnesota, educates and informs the public about local history by providing programs, exhibits and special events at their museum, archives and five historic sites. Their collection includes artifacts, records and photographs from county towns and cities, businesses, organizations and individuals and the collections from several local photography studios. Included in the Olmsted County Historical Society project for Minnesota Reflections are photographs from the aftermath of a tornado that destroyed much of the city of Rochester in 1883 and of the development of St. Mary's Hospital and the Mayo Medical Complex as well as family images of the W.W. Mayo family.
oclcdc.creator: Olmsted County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Olmsted County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Otsego Heritage Preservation Commission (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Otsego County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Otsego Heritage Preservation Commission is an advisory commission authorized by the city of Otsego, Minnesota, in 1994. Its mission is to discover, preserve, interpret and communicate Otsego history and culture and to enhance our sense of connection and appreciation for each other, our present environment and our legacy. The 1854 Otsego cemetery plat map and the justices of the peace dockets of 1884-1912 are illustrative of our story and culture at those times. Its availability on Minnesota Reflections enhances our connection and appreciation of that legacy.
oclcdc.creator: Otsego Heritage Preservation Commission
oclcdc.rights: Reproduce only with the permission of the city of Otsego, MN.

oclcdc.title: Otter Tail County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Otter Tail County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Otter Tail County Historical Society in Fergus Falls, Minnesota, collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to the history of Otter Tail County. For Minnesota Reflections, the society contributed more than 130 images that show early development of this west central county including, business activities, events, homes and group portraits.
oclcdc.creator: Otter Tail County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Copyright Otter Tail County Historical Society. Contact contributing institution for reproduction.

oclcdc.title: Pennington County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Pennington County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: From its home in Thief River Falls in northwestern Minnesota, the Pennington County Historical Society works to discover, collect and preserve photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to the history of Pennington County. For Minnesota Reflections, this historical society contributed photographs from the work of Jacob Borry and O. A. Holm that show the early development of Pennington County including timber and railroad activities, events and street scenes from county towns.
oclcdc.creator: Pennington County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of Pennington County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Pipestone County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Pipestone County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Located in a former city hall building now on the National Register of Historic Places, the Pipestone County Museum, Pipestone, Minnesota, is home to the Pipestone County Historical Society, which collects artifacts, creates exhibits, maintains archives and a research library, and provides programming relating to this southwestern county. Their holdings include photographs, county newspapers, Native American artifacts, school records, agricultural artifacts and textiles. For Minnesota Reflections, Pipestone County Museum contributed images featuring the National Pipestone Monument area including the Three Maidens, Winnewissa Falls, Leaping Rock and the works of 1880s photographers G.L. Chesley, F.B. Eykyn and F.O. Pease.
oclcdc.creator: Pipestone County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Pipestone County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Pope County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Pope County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Pope County Historical Society in Glenwood, Minnesota, collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to the history of Pope County. The historical society's contribution to Minnesota Reflections features the work of M.J. Trenham, a portrait and landscape photographer from Alexandria, Minnesota. Subjects include businesses, residences and town scenes.
oclcdc.creator: Pope County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be used without the expressed, written permission of the Pope County Historical Society. Contract, fees and use of appropriate credit line may apply.

oclcdc.title: Renville County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Renville County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Renville County Historical Society preserves the history of Renville County with a museum in its home location of Morton, Minnesota. The historical society collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts. For Minnesota Reflections, the Renville County Historical Society contributed five photographs each of 10 of this south central county's towns. The photographs were taken from the 1870s to 1904.
oclcdc.creator: Renville County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without written consent of the Renville County Historical Society

oclcdc.title: Rice County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Rice County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Rice County Historical Society, located on the fairgrounds in Faribault, Minnesota, was founded in 1926 as an outgrowth of the Old Settlers Association, formed in 1874. The mission is to "collect, preserve, and interpret the history of Rice County and the State of Minnesota.” This mission has guided us over the years and continues to be our focus for everything we do. The material submitted to Minnesota Reflections is from our Holy Cross Episcopal Church collection, formerly located in Dundas, Bridgewater Township, Rice County, Minnesota.  These images range in dates from the 1870s to the 1990s.
oclcdc.creator: Rice County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Rice County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Richfield Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Richfield Historical Society collects, preserves, and shares the story of Richfield, Minnesota, from its time as a large rural township that encompassed much of south Minneapolis and many surrounding communities to its growth as a market farming center and its early development as a suburb. From roots to ramblers to re-use, Richfield Historical Society maintains a museum as well as the 1852 Bartholomew House in the heart of Richfield.
oclcdc.creator: Richfield Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may be subject to copyright laws. Please contact the Richfield Historical Society for permission to publish these images. http://www.richfieldhistory.org

oclcdc.title: Rochester Community and Technical College (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Olmsted County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Rochester Community and Technical College was founded in 1915 on a motion by Dr. Charles Mayo to the Rochester School Board. Rochester is Minnesota’s oldest community college and one of the nation’s oldest, original community colleges. The images in Minnesota Reflections include the commencement programs from 1918-1960 and the student newspaper “The Jaysee Echo” from 1940-May 1963.
oclcdc.creator: Rochester Community and Technical College
oclcdc.rights: Images or text within this collection may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of Rocester Community and Technical College.

oclcdc.title: Rockford Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Rockford Area Historical Society, which operates the historic Ames-Florida-Stork House in Rockford, MN, maintains a large collection of artifacts and written documents pertaining to the Ames, Florida, and Stork families who owned the house beginning in 1856. The RAHS conducts tours and programs centered on these items to further promote the heritage and lifestyle of the families during their time in Rockford, but also St. Paul, Jasper, and Illinois. The RAHS’s contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes images of the William Stork family, taken between 1880 and 1920, and the daily diaries of William’s daughter, Florence, written during her teenage years.
oclcdc.creator: Rockford Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. And international copyright. Contact the Rockford Area Historical Society of permission to use these images.

oclcdc.title: Roseau County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Roseau County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Roseau County Historical Society, in Roseau, Minnesota, gathers manuscripts, photographs, printed materials, American Indian artifacts and personal and public items to help people learn about the history of this northwest Minnesota county. They display much of this history in the Roseau County Historical Museum. The historical society contributed more than 100 images to Minnesota Reflections showing agriculture, business and labor, education, ethnic groups, recreation, leisure and transportation.
oclcdc.creator: Roseau County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Roseau County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Sacred Heart Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Renville County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Sacred Heart Area Historical Society, located in the town of Sacred Heart in Renville County, Minnesota, collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to the German and Scandinavian settlement of this western part of Minnesota. For Minnesota Reflections, the Sacred Heart Area Historical Society contributed the photographic work of A.T. Ellingboe; Emil I. Olsen; O.S. Myhre; and Ole C. Sparstad. The subjects include businesses, residences and town scenes.
oclcdc.creator: Sacred Heart Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Scared Heart Area Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: St. Benedict's Monastery (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stearns County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The archivists at the St. Benedict's Monastery, home of the Sisters of the Order of St. Benedict in St. Joseph, Minnesota, document the history and mission of this Catholic order with more than 4,000 artifacts dating to 1857. The monastery contributed to Minnesota Reflections images of the sisters and their missions in towns across the state. The photographs show the convent, grade schools and high schools, hospitals, the orphanage in St. Joseph, the White Earth Mission and portraits.
oclcdc.creator: St. Benedict's Monastery
oclcdc.rights: Copyright© Saint Benedict's Monastery. All Rights Reserved.

oclcdc.title: St. Catherine University (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The St. Catherine University Archives contain historical documents of the college from its founding in 1905, those of St. Mary's School of Nursing (1900 -1966), and St. Mary's Junior College, founded in 1964 and merged with St. Catherine in 1986. The images in Minnesota Reflections are those of the early days at St. Catherine and include images of students, buildings, and activities on campus.
oclcdc.creator: St. Catherine University
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the College of St. Catherine.

oclcdc.title: St. Cloud State University (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stearns County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The St. Cloud State University Archives maintains the corporate memory of St. Cloud State University by preserving and using records and publications of long-term value. Archival material documents the University's development and serves as a convenient source of reliable information about SCSU's programs, people, policies, and property. Images available on Minnesota Reflections touch on a variety of St. Cloud State topics: presidents, athletics, students, and buildings.
oclcdc.creator: St. Cloud State University
oclcdc.rights: These images may be reproduced for educational purposes only. All other uses require the express written permission of St. Cloud State University.

set.setName: St. Cloud State University - Sinclair Lewis Collection

oclcdc.title: St. Cloud State University - Sinclair Lewis Collection (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stearns County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Sinclair Lewis Letters to Marcella Powers Collection includes 262 letters and one poem written by author Sinclair Lewis to his intimate friend Marcella Powers between 1939 and 1947. Lewis discusses his career and his writing, his feelings for Powers, and his social life. A guide to the collection is available at St. Cloud State University Archives. The Archives has in its collection in the James W. Miller Learning Resources Center other Sinclair Lewis related material including Lewis Family Papers, Hubert Gibson Collection of Sinclair Lewis, the Ida Compton Papers, and the Joan McQuary Collection of Sinclair Lewis Letters.
oclcdc.creator: St. Cloud State University - Sinclair Lewis Collection
oclcdc.rights: Copyright 2009 JP Morgan Chase, Administrator de bonis non, Estate of Sinclair Lewis. These materials may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Estate of Sinclair Lewis. Please contact the St. Cloud State University Archives for further information.

oclcdc.title: St. Croix Watershed Research Station (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Washington County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The mission of the St. Croix Watershed Research Station, the environmental research station of the Science Museum of Minnesota located on the St. Croix River just south of Marine on St. Croix, Minnesota, is to foster a better understanding of the ecological systems of the St. Croix River basin and watersheds worldwide. Founded in 1989, the station is a center for long-term ecological research studies of land-water interaction. Collections of the J.W.G. Dunn Research Library of the research station include historical items, scientific journals and reference books, agency and government reports on the St. Croix River and watershed maps, photographs, slides and audio visual materials. The collection in Minnesota Reflections includes historic maps of the St. Croix and Mississippi rivers and the surrounding areas.
oclcdc.creator: St. Croix Watershed Research Station
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the St. Croix Watershed Research Station.

oclcdc.title: Saint John's Abbey (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stearns County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Saint John's Abbey Archives, founded in 1871, collects, preserves and makes available to the public materials that show the history of the Saint John's Abbey in Collegeville, Minnesota, from 1856 to the present. The collection preserves the life and history of the abbey and its members, through manuscript collections, letters, diaries, journals, publications, clippings, photographs, audiotapes, films, oral histories, and liturgical and spiritual materials. The Saint John's Abbey Archives project for Minnesota Reflections shows the Catholic culture and people of rural Central Minnesota from 1872 to 1908.
oclcdc.creator: Saint John's Abbey
oclcdc.rights: Copyright© St. John's Abbey. All Rights Reserved.

oclcdc.title: Saint Olaf College (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Rice County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Shaw-Olson Center for College History at St. Olaf College in Northfield, Minnesota, maintains paper records, photographs and recordings that document the college's history and actively collects historical materials about St. Olaf graduates. The center's holdings include the Ole G. Felland collection of St. Olaf and Norwegian-American photographs and records from defunct Lutheran schools (notably, the Red Wing Seminary, in Red Wing, Minnesota). For Minnesota Reflections, St. Olaf College contributed images of the original college buildings: the main building, Ladies' Hall (the first women's dormitory), Ytterboe Hall (the first men's dormitory), Steensland Library, Hoyme Chapel and the president's house.
oclcdc.creator: Saint Olaf College
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the express written consent of the St. Olaf College, Shaw-Olson Center for College History.

oclcdc.title: St. Paul Public Housing Agency (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Saint Paul Public Housing Agency (PHA) has been an independent governmental unit since 1977. Its roots are in the Housing and Redevelopment Authority of the City of Saint Paul (HRA), whose initial goal was to remove slums and construct low income housing. During the 1950s and 1960s, family public housing took the form of townhouse style developments. Mt. Airy Homes is one such development and now includes 298 townhouse units and a 152-unit hi-rise building. The PHA contributed to Minnesota Reflections a hand-written plan from the 1930s for this development. Today, the PHA owns and manages 4,249 units of public housing in Saint Paul.
oclcdc.creator: St. Paul Public Housing Agency
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is restricted by US and International copyright.

oclcdc.title: Saint Paul Public Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Saint Paul Public Library was founded in 1882, and now serves the city of Saint Paul, Minnesota from a Central Library, 12 branches, and a bookmobile. Among is special collections, the library maintains documents and other items detailing Saint Paul's history. The library contributed to Minnesota Reflections nearly 50 images taken between 1913 and 1916 capturing the Central Library during various phases of its construction and a collection of aerial photos of St. Paul from the mid-1920s. The construction photographs also depict equipment, practices and other details of the period.
oclcdc.creator: Saint Paul Public Library
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Saint Paul Public Library.

oclcdc.title: St. Peter Regional Treatment Center (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Nicollet County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The St. Peter Regional Treatment Center, in St. Peter, Minnesota, is the state's earliest psychiatric treatment facility. Established in 1866, it was first known as the Asylum for the Insane and later as the St. Peter State Hospital. For Minnesota Reflections, the museum at the St. Peter Regional Treatment Center contributed three albums of photographs taken from approximately 1915 through the early 1930s. These photographs are witness to early 20th century life and treatment during the hospital's early years.
oclcdc.creator: Nicollet County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written permission of the Nicollet County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: St. Raphael Catholic Church (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Brown County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: St. Raphael Catholic Church, Springfield, Minnesota, was established in 1874 by a well-known pioneer priest from New Ulm, Reverend Alexander Berghold. St. Raphael Catholic Church contributed to Minnesota Reflections photography of Rev. John Gmeiner, who was a priest, a author, lecturer, scientist, and photographer. He served as pastor of St. Raphael Catholic Church in Springfield from 1902 to 1908. These images include churches, children, families, and early 1900 landscapes. In his photography, Rev Gmeiner, an immigrant from Germany, developed his own glass negatives using his own formulas and skill.
oclcdc.creator: St. Raphael Catholic Church
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of St. Raphael Catholic Church of Springfield, Minnesota.

oclcdc.title: St. Scholastica Monastery (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Benedictine Sisters came to Duluth in 1881 from St. Joseph, Minnesota, and formed an independent community in 1892. The community motherhouse has been known as Sacred Heart Institute (1892), Villa Sancta Scholastica (1909), Saint Scholastica Priory (1959) and Saint Scholastica Monastery (1996). Institutions founded by the Sisters include St. Mary's Hospital (1888) and the College of St. Scholastica (1912) in Duluth, and St. Joseph's Hospital in Brainerd, Minnesota. A secondary school for young women (most recently named Stanbrook Hall) was an integral part of their ministry until 1967. The sisters taught in parish schools across Minnesota and staffed orphanages and retirement homes. Their collection in Minnesota Reflections contains photographs of the motherhouses and of the sisters at work and play together with their students. Early photos from the St. Mary's Hospital archives are also included.
oclcdc.creator: St. Scholastica Monastery
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Images are property of St. Scholastica Monastery. Please contact St. Scholastica Monastery Archives for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Salem Covenant Church, Duluth, Minnesota (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Salem Covenant Church (Duluth, Minnesota) was founded October 14, 1890, by Swedish immigrants and was originally named the Swedish Christian Mission Church of West Duluth. From the beginning, Salem's emphasis has been on local and global mission work. The current congregation remains active in missions. The Salem Covenant Church archives maintains manuscript, book, photograph, and audio/visual materials documenting the history of the church, the Swedish immigrants who founded it, and the many voices that continue the church's mission. The items contributed to Minnesota Reflections represent a sampling of images and documents from the first 75 years of Salem's history.
oclcdc.creator: Salem Covenant Church (Duluth, Minnesota)
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact the Salem Covenant Church Archives, Duluth, Minnesota, for permission to use these images.

oclcdc.title: Sauk Centre Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stearns County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Sauk Centre Area Historical Society, in Sauk Centre, Minnesota, was founded in 1987 to collect for, and disseminate to, the public historical artifacts and information on the churches, businesses, and local families. The goal of the society is to sustain the knowledge of the past while recording current events for future generations, and to engender in our children an interest in local history. The society supports genealogical research for local families and their decedents. Images the Sauk Centre Area Historical Society contributed to Minnesota Reflections show prominent families, early businesses, education and churches that highlight the development of the community of Sauk Centre. Also included is the first volume of the Sauk Centre Herald.
oclcdc.creator: Sauk Centre Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. international copyright laws. Please contact the Sauk Centre Area Historical Society for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: Schroeder Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Cook County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Schroeder Area Historical Society is a non-profit organization established in 1996 that operates the Cross River Heritage Center in Schroeder, Minnesota. Schroeder’s history is much deeper than it appears today and the mission of the Schroeder Area Historical Society is to research, document, record, and preserve the unique history of Schroeder Township and its residents as well as provide insight and reference for future generations. The Schroeder Area Historical Society's oral history collection is a series of audio and video taped interviews completed from 1999 to 2011 including early settlers, children and grandchildren of the early settlers, and more recent year-round and summer residents.
oclcdc.creator: Schroeder Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These oral histories may not be reproduced without the express written consent of the Schroeder Area Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Scott County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Scott County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: From its home in the Stans Museum in Shakopee, Minnesota, the Scott County Historical Society searches for and preserves the history and cultural heritage of Scott County. They share their history through exhibits and educational programs. The Scott County collection includes archival items, artifacts, and photographs that relate to residents, businesses and social heritage and the Maurice Stans government papers and African collection. The Scott County Historical Society contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes images of the development of the Shakopee and Belle Plaine areas including business, social and architectural history.
oclcdc.creator: Scott County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the consent of the Scott County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Sherburne County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Sherburne County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Sherburne County Historical Society helps the people of this Central Minnesota county develop an appreciation for the area's settlement and history. The historical society operates the Sherburne History Center in Becker, Minnesota, where it collects, preserves and interprets the history of Sherburne County. Our Minnesota Reflections contribution includes images of the Charles M. Babcock house in Elk River, buildings of historic significance in Becker, the 1903 plat book of Sherburne County and 1898 Mississippi River maps.
oclcdc.creator: Sherburne County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Sherburne County Historical Society. Please contact SCHS for more information in regard to these images at: 763-261-4433 or Sherburne County Historical Society [schs@sherbtel.net].

set.setName: Sisters of St. Joseph of Carondelet

oclcdc.title: Sisters of St. Joseph of Carondelet (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The history of the Sisters of St. Joseph of Carondelet, St. Paul Province, reflects the historical development of St. Paul and Minneapolis and the state of Minnesota. The sisters arrived in St. Paul in 1851, before Minnesota became a state, and opened schools, hospitals and social service agencies for the people of the area. The mission of the Archives of the Sisters of St. Joseph is to preserve and share the history, spirit, and memory of the St. Paul Province.
oclcdc.creator: Sisters of St. Joseph of Carondelet
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the written permissions of the Sisters of St. Joseph of Carondelet, St. Paul Province, 1884 Randolph Ave., St. Paul, MN 55105-1700.

oclcdc.title: Soudan Underground Mine State Park (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Soudan Underground Mine State Park is a former iron ore mine located on the Vermilion Iron Range in Soudan, Minnesota. In 1962 the mine was turned over to the State of Minnesota and it opened as a State Park in 1965. We strive to preserve the history of the mine and the area. We offer tours of the underground mine and we have exhibits dedicated to the history of the area. Our collection consists of maps of the various underground levels and photos of miners and mining life.
oclcdc.creator: Soudan Underground Mine State Park
oclcdc.rights: These images intended for single, educational use. All other rights reserved. Express written consent of the Soudan Underground Mine State Park is required for any non educational, multiple use.

set.setName: Southwest Minnesota State University Striegel Archives

oclcdc.title: Southwest Minnesota State University, Striegel Archives (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Lyon County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Southwest Minnesota State University McFarland Library supports university curriculum by teaching course-integrated library instruction and by providing a learning environment and collections supporting research in various disciplines. The Striegel Archives, named after a retired SMSU librarian, houses materials significant enough to SMSU to merit a permanent place in the library. The largest collection in the Archives documents the history of SMSU administration, classes and student body, including committee minutes, program reviews, photographs, playbills, and oral histories. The Striegel Archives hopes that, through Minnesota Reflections, it can inform a wider audience of the university's history from its founding.
oclcdc.creator: Southwest Minnesota State University, Striegel Archives
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images may be governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Images are the property of Striegel Archives, Southwest Minnesota State University.

oclcdc.title: Stearns History Museum (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stearns County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Stearns History Museum in St. Cloud, Minnesota, collects photographs, printed materials and artifacts related to the history of Stearns County. They share this information in a two-story exhibit hall, a library and research center and through educational programming. The Stearns History Museum contributed to Minnesota Reflections images that show early street scenes from towns across the county, business activities, granite quarries, farming and transportation.
oclcdc.creator: Stearns History Museum
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Stearns History Museum.

oclcdc.title: Stevens County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stevens County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: From its prairie home in Morris, Minnesota, the Stevens County Historical Society collects photographs, printed materials and esotartifacts that tell the story of the role Stevens County in the movement of settlers into the Dakotas and the western prairies. For Minnesota Reflections, the Stevens County Historical Society shared images of the American Indian Boarding School, which eventually became the University of Minnesota, Morris. Other images capture the development of rural west central Minnesota, which include agricultural, industrial, social, labor, architectural and construction history.
oclcdc.creator: Stevens County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright law. Please contact the Stevens County Museum & Historical Society, in Morris, MN you can reach them online at http://www.stevenshistorymuseum.com.

oclcdc.title: Stewartville Public Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Olmsted County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Stewartville Public Library provides the people of the Stewartville, Minnesota, area with library services and has preserved some photographs and printed materials related to the history of this southeast Minnesota town. The library contributed images from the late 1800s to Minnesota Reflections of homes in the area, including the house that was the birthplace of Richard Sears of the Sears and Roebuck Corporation.
oclcdc.creator: Stewartville Public Library
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the expressed consent of the Stewartville Area Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Stillwater Public Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Washington County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: In addition to serving the eastern Minnesota community of Stillwater, Minnesota as its library, the Stillwater Public Library preserves historical collections, including photographs, of this town on the banks of the St. Croix River. The Stillwater Public Library's contribution to Minnesota Reflections includes images of the James Sinclair stereopticon slides. Sinclair was a Stillwater area photographer from approximately 1876 to 1890. His collection, Views In and Around Stillwater, portrays people and scenes in the late 1800s. Most images feature scenes of early Stillwater businesses, homes and views of the St. Croix River.
oclcdc.creator: Stillwater Public Library
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Stillwater Public Library.

set.setName: Synod of Lakes and Prairies (of the Presbyterian Church)

oclcdc.title: Synod of Lakes and Prairies (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Dakota County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Synod of the Lakes and Prairies, located in Eagan, Minnesota, serves the mission of the Presbyterian Church (USA) throughout its region which includes a wide area of the upper Midwest. It supports the ministry of the 16 presbyteries within its bounds of nearly 900 churches and 150,000 members. Presbyterian work to the Dakota Indian nations and this geographic territory was established in 1844. The materials submitted represent a sampling of documents developed for use by Dakota missions, schools and agencies. The collection in Minnesota Reflections represents a partnership between the Synod and Dakota Wicohan, whose mission is to preserve Dakota as a living language, and through it, transmit Dakota life ways to future generations.
oclcdc.creator: Synod of Lakes and Prairies (of the Presbyterian Church)
oclcdc.rights: These documents may be reproduced and used freely for educational purposes without written permission. However, to use the digital reproductions for any other reason, users must have the express written consent of the Synod of Lakes and Prairies, 2115 Cliff Drive, Eagan, MN 55122.

oclcdc.title: Teacher Guides (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Teacher Guides to Minnesota Reflections were developed as a special resource for K-12 teachers and their students. The guides, written by 13 teachers from across the state, aim to help teachers use the photos, maps, documents, and sound recordings in the collection to meet state or national academic standards. The guides address all grade levels. While each focuses on one grade level, many provide advice on how to use the with students in other grades. The guides address standards in six subject areas and across all grade levels: Art, Family and Consumer Science, Language Arts, Mathematics, Science, and Social Studies. The Minnesota Digital Library’s Teacher Guides project began in 2011. Marian Rengel, MDL Outreach Coordinator, worked with an advisory group of school media specialists and teachers to create the scope of the guides and to recruit teachers to write the guides. Advisory Group members were: Mary Alice Anderson, Marcia Applen, Mary Johnson, Sue Tabaka-Kritzeck, and Ann Woell. The first year brought in 49 guides; year two brought in 24 more guides.
oclcdc.creator: Minnesota Digital Library
oclcdc.rights: The Teacher Guides were created by and for Minnesota educators and teachers and are freely available to all Minnesota Digital Library users.

oclcdc.title: Todd County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Stearns County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Todd County Historical Society in Long Prairie, Minnesota was organized to preserve the history and artifacts and genealogies of the residents of Todd County in a safe location for the generations to come. For Minnesota Reflections, Todd County contributed its 1906 county plat book.
oclcdc.creator: Todd County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Todd County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Trondhjem Community Preservation Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Rice County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Trondhjem Community Preservation Society, Inc. is a non-profit corporation formed to preserve and care for the historic Trondhjem Church in rural Lonsdale, Minnesota, and to collect the history of this 19th century Norwegian immigrant community. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places, the building was constructed in 1878 and rebuilt in 1899. The building now serves as venue for community events, family reunions, concerts and weddings. Adjoining the church is a museum displaying historic community photographs and a story of the Trondhjem’s development beginning in the 1860s. The collection in Minnesota Reflections includes original images from our exhibit and personal letters sent to Private Ole Berg from his friends and parents during his service in World War I.
oclcdc.creator: Trondhjem Community Preservation Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Trondhjem Community Preservation Society.

oclcdc.title: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, St. Paul District, administers lock and dam building and operations for the upper Mississippi River region and maintains historic collections related to its activities. From headquarters in St. Paul, Minnesota, this district office has served the upper Mississippi River basin and surrounding areas since 1866. The St. Paul District office contributed to Minnesota Reflections images from the Henry P. Bosse (1844-1903) photographic collection of the Upper Mississippi taken between 1883 and 1892, while Bosse was employed as a draftsman by the Corps. His images include long-vanished vistas of bluffs and coulees, rapidly growing cities, workboats pulling snags out of new channels, rock quarries, dredging operations and construction of dams and bridges.
oclcdc.creator: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, St. Paul District
oclcdc.rights: Public domain.

oclcdc.title: University of Minnesota, Duluth (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: St. Louis County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The University of Minnesota, Duluth Archives, located in the campus library, collects and preserves publications, photographs, memorabilia and university records from its early days as the Duluth Normal School (later becoming the Duluth State Teachers College). The University of Minnesota, Duluth Library contributed to Minnesota Reflections images of the Duluth Normal School from about 1904. They include scenes of women students in a carpentry workshop and a science classroom, pictures from the music room and a kindergarten classroom.
oclcdc.creator: University of Minnesota, Duluth
oclcdc.rights: Contact University of Minnesota Duluth Archives for permission to use image.

set.setName: University of Minnesota Libraries, John R. Borchert Map Library

oclcdc.title: University of Minnesota Libraries, John R. Borchert Map Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The John R. Borchert Map Library collection at the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities Libraries includes maps of Minnesota from the 1850s to the present, United States Geological Survey topographic maps and aerial photographs for the state of Minnesota from the late 1930s to the present. The library also includes atlases and thematic and topographic maps for most countries in the world, some dating back as many as 400 years. For Minnesota Reflections, the John R. Borchert Map Library contributed maps and atlases including city and county plat books and a late 19th-century atlas published by the Mississippi River Commission.
oclcdc.creator: University of Minnesota Libraries, John R. Borchert Map Library
oclcdc.rights: The image may be reproduced without permission. To obtain a high resolution copy of this image, please contact the Borchert Map Library.

set.setName: University of Minnesota Libraries, Kautz Family YMCA Archives

oclcdc.title: University of Minnesota Libraries, Kautz Family YMCA Archives (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Kautz Family YMCA Archives at the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities Libraries holds materials related to the early establishment of the YMCA in the United States and in Minneapolis, Minnesota. The Kautz Family YMCA Archives contributed to Minnesota Reflections images that show the YMCA building and associated activities of the organization including early basketball and gymnastics teams and English classes attended by immigrants.
oclcdc.creator: University of Minnesota Libraries, Kautz Family YMCA Archives
oclcdc.rights: Subject to U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact the University of Minnesota, Kautz Family YMCA Archives.

set.setName: University of Minnesota Libraries, Minnesota Orchestra Archives

oclcdc.title: University of Minnesota Libraries, Minnesota Orchestra Archives (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Minnesota Orchestra Archives at the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities Libraries includes materials from throughout the 100 years of this orchestra, which is considered one of the top orchestras in the United States. For Minnesota Reflections, the Minnesota Orchestra Archives shared images of musicians and conductors from the early foundation of the orchestra in 1903.
oclcdc.creator: University of Minnesota Libraries, Minnesota Orchestra Archives
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images may be governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Please contact the Performing Arts Archives for permission to publish these images. http://special.lib.umn.edu/manuscripts/perfart.html.

set.setName: University of Minnesota Libraries, Northwest Architectural Archives

oclcdc.title: University of Minnesota Libraries, Northwest Architectural Archives (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Northwest Architectural Archives at the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities Libraries collects the records of architects, engineers, contractors, landscape architects and interior designers from Minnesota and surrounding areas. This includes drawings, photographs and job files. They contributed to Minnesota Reflections images from the architectural drawings of Harvey Ellis (1854 - 1904) taken between 1887 and 1891.
oclcdc.creator: University of Minnesota Libraries, Northwest Architectural Archives
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is subject to U.S. and international copyright laws. These images may not be reproduced for any commercial use without the express permission of the copyright holder.

set.setName: University of Minnesota Libraries, University Archives

oclcdc.title: University of Minnesota Libraries, University Archives (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The University Archives at the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities Libraries collects, maintains and provides access to historical documents of the University of Minnesota. For Minnesota Reflections, University Archives contributed images that show the teaching, learning and service mission of the University of Minnesota, with emphasis on images from the College of Agriculture.
oclcdc.creator: University of Minnesota Libraries, University Archives
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Images are property of the University of Minnesota. Please contact the University of Minnesota Archives for permission to publish these images.

oclcdc.title: University of St. Thomas (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The University of St. Thomas Special Collections in the O'Shaughnessy-Frey Library in St. Paul, Minnesota documents the history of the university (formerly known as a college), the St. Paul Seminary, the Nazareth Hall Seminary, the St. John Vianney Seminary, the St. Thomas Military Academy (to 1965) and the Catholic Digest (1939 to 2001). Among its holdings are the official records of administrative offices, academic departments and student organizations, the college newspaper and the college and academy yearbooks. The images the University of St. Thomas contributed to Minnesota Reflections include images of the campus and faculty and student activities.
oclcdc.creator: University of St. Thomas
oclcdc.rights: These images may be reproduced and used freely for the educational purposes without written permission. set.setName: University of St. Thomas - Ireland Memorial Library

oclcdc.title: University of St. Thomas - Ireland Memorial Library (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Archbishop Ireland Memorial Library is the graduate theological library of the University of St. Thomas in St. Paul, Minnesota. Affiliated with The St. Paul Seminary School of Divinity, it provides curricular support for programs that prepare ordained and lay leaders for ministry. The Archbishop Ireland Memorial Library is widely known for its holdings in biblical studies, Catholic theology, sacraments, liturgical studies, and Church history. Various items in its Rare Book Collection are from Archbishop John Ireland's personal collection. This collection includes imprints of religious instruction, New Testament selections, and printed music and hymns in Native languages common to Minnesota published from 1850 to 1925, and temperance tracts by Archbishop John Ireland and Monsignor James Reardon published from 1875 to 1909.
oclcdc.creator: University of St. Thomas - Ireland Memorial Library
oclcdc.rights: These images may be reproduced and used freely for educational purposes without written permission. However, in order to use the digital reproductions for any other reason, users must have the express written consent of the University of St. Thomas Libraries, 2115 Summit Avenue, Saint Paul, MN 55105 e-mail: libweb@stthomas.edu.

oclcdc.title: Wanda Gag House (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Brown County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Wanda Gag House Association museum is the historic residence of author Wanda Hazel Gag in New Ulm, Minnesota. The association contributed to Minnesota Reflections an image taken in about 1900 of the home Wanda Gage lived in as a girl.
oclcdc.creator: Wanda Gag House
oclcdc.rights: This image may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Wanda Gag House Association.

oclcdc.title: Waseca County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Waseca County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Since 1938, Waseca County Historical Society in Waseca, Minnesota has preserved and interpreted the history of the county, organized in 1857. As a county museum and research library, WCHS is proud to be the primary historical resource for its current and former residents, and many visitors on site and online. We are proud to join in the Minnesota Digital Library to bring our original 1857 Waseca County Minutes to Minnesota Reflections. The story of the formation of the townships, towns, school districts, and the names of the settlers who made it all happen are here in this original record of early Waseca County history.
oclcdc.creator: Waseca County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced without the express written consent of the Waseca County Historical Society

set.setName: Washington County – Survey and Land Management Division

oclcdc.title: Washington County – Survey and Land Management Division (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Washington County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Washington County Surveyor's Office in Stillwater, Minnesota perpetuates the location of section corners that were established in 1847 for the United States Public Land Survey. Section corners are the foundation of land ownership. Townships in Washington County were among the first areas surveyed in Minnesota, as part of the Territory of Wisconsin. Following the government survey, a District Surveyor (later County Surveyor) was selected to survey roads, make maps, and maintain the government corners. Items for this Minnesota Reflections collection include survey records of some of the first roads in Minnesota dating to 1847, early parcel maps of Washington County, and the 1912 Plat Book.
oclcdc.creator: Washington County – Survey and Land Management Division
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. The map and its contents is the property of Washington County. Please contact the Washington County Surveyor for permission to publish any part of this map.

oclcdc.title: Watonwan County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Watonwan County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: Watonwan County Historical Society, in Madelia, Minnesota, collects and preserves artifacts, photographs and manuscripts that tell the story of the growth and expansion of our county. It houses extensive records used by patrons for genealogy research on people, towns and events. The Watonwan County Historical Society submitted more than 100 photographs to Minnesota Reflections, recording the county's history from the beginning to the present time.
oclcdc.creator: Watonwan County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Rights to these images are governed by U.S. and international copyright law. For more information please contact the Watonwan County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Westonka Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Hennepin County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Westonka Historical Society, located on the northwest bank of Lake Minnetonka in western Hennepin County, Minnesota began meeting in 1967. We are committed to preserving records, gathering artifacts, and making our history accessible. WHS supports research on Tonka Toys, Inc., which began in 1947 in Mound, Minnesota; on the Andrews Sisters, who summered at Lake Minnetonka; and on the glory days of tourists visiting the large hotels on the Upper Lake from the 1880s to the1930s. Images in Minnesota Reflections include a selection from our extensive postcard collection and maps, photos of the Tonka Toy factory, and two Native American watercolors.
oclcdc.creator: Westonka Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Westonka Historical Society.

set.setName: White Bear Lake Area Historical Society

oclcdc.title: White Bear Lake Area Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Ramsey County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The White Bear Lake Area Historical Society in White Bear Lake, Minn., serves the public with a museum, archives and resource library. The collection, which spans nearly 150 years, includes artifacts, photographs and records relating to the resorts, railroads, businesses and governments of the five municipalities that touch White Bear Lake, just north of St. Paul. For \\\"Minnesota Reflections\\\" the historical society contributed images of White Bear Lake's heyday as Minnesota's first resort town and includes images of the resorts and visitors and the communities that developed to serve them.
oclcdc.creator: White Bear Lake Area Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: Use of these images is governed by U.S. and international copyright laws. Image is property of the White Bear Lake Area Historical Society. Please contact the White Bear Lake Area Historical Society for permission to publish this image.

oclcdc.title: Winona County Historical Society (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Winona County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The mission of the Winona County Historical Society, located in Winona, Minnesota, is to collect, preserve, and interpret materials that document the human history of Winona County. The main museum, which used to serve as the county's National Guard Armory, features a time-line of Winona County history, an award-winning children's exhibit, a large library and archives, collection storage, offices, programming space, a gift shop and used bookstore. The Society also operates two smaller museums, the Bunnell House, an 1850s Gothic style house, and the Arches Museum, a complex of buildings and exhibits focused on the agricultural and pioneer history of the county. The Society maintains a very active educational programming schedule, and features many special events and publications throughout the year.
oclcdc.creator: Winona County Historical Society
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of the Winona County Historical Society.

oclcdc.title: Winona State University (Digital collection)
oclcdc.subject: Winona County; Minnesota; United States
oclcdc.description: The Winona State University library holds archives related to the records and early development of the institution, the oldest "normal school" west of the Mississippi River and the birthplace of the National Education Association. Images Winona State University contributed to Minnesota Reflections show campus activities including faculty, students, athletics, activities and class photographs.
oclcdc.creator: Winona State University
oclcdc.rights: These images may not be reproduced for any reason without the express written consent of Winona State University.
